commands.name: az networkcloud clustermanager create
commands.summary: Create a new cluster manager or update properties of the cluster manager if it exists.
commands.syntax:
az networkcloud clustermanager create --cluster-manager-name
                                      --fabric-controller-id
                                      --resource-group
                                      [--analytics-workspace-id]
                                      [--location]
                                      [--managed-resource-group-configuration]
                                      [--mi-system-assigned {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                      [--mi-user-assigned]
                                      [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                      [--tags]
examples: az networkcloud clustermanager create --name "clusterManagerName" --location "location" --analytics-workspace-id "/subscriptions/subscriptionId/resourceGroups/resourceGroupName/providers/microsoft.operationalInsights/workspaces/logAnalyticsWorkspaceName" --fabric-controller-id "/subscriptions/subscriptionId/resourceGroups/resourceGroupName/providers/Microsoft.ManagedNetworkFabric/networkFabricControllers/fabricControllerName" --managed-resource-group-configuration name="my-managed-rg" --tags key1="myvalue1" key2="myvalue2" --resource-group "resourceGroupName"

az networkcloud clustermanager create --name "clusterManagerName" --location "location" --analytics-workspace-id "/subscriptions/subscriptionId/resourceGroups/resourceGroupName/providers/microsoft.operationalInsights/workspaces/logAnalyticsWorkspaceName" --fabric-controller-id "/subscriptions/subscriptionId/resourceGroups/resourceGroupName/providers/Microsoft.ManagedNetworkFabric/networkFabricControllers/fabricControllerName" --managed-resource-group-configuration name="my-managed-rg" --tags key1="myvalue1" key2="myvalue2" --resource-group "resourceGroupName" --mi-system-assigned

az networkcloud clustermanager create --name "clusterManagerName" --location "location" --analytics-workspace-id "/subscriptions/subscriptionId/resourceGroups/resourceGroupName/providers/microsoft.operationalInsights/workspaces/logAnalyticsWorkspaceName" --fabric-controller-id "/subscriptions/subscriptionId/resourceGroups/resourceGroupName/providers/Microsoft.ManagedNetworkFabric/networkFabricControllers/fabricControllerName" --managed-resource-group-configuration name="my-managed-rg" --tags key1="myvalue1" key2="myvalue2" --resource-group "resourceGroupName" --mi-user-assigned "/subscriptions/subscriptionId/resourceGroups/resourceGroupName/providers/Microsoft.ManagedIdentity/userAssignedIdentities/myUAI"

commands.name: az networkcloud clustermanager delete
commands.syntax:
az networkcloud clustermanager delete [--cluster-manager-name]
                                      [--ids]
                                      [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                      [--resource-group]
                                      [--subscription]
                                      [--yes]

commands.name: az networkcloud clustermanager list
commands.summary: List cluster managers in the provided resource group or subscription.

commands.name: az networkcloud clustermanager show
commands.summary: Get the properties of the provided cluster manager.

commands.name: az networkcloud clustermanager update
commands.summary: Update properties of the provided cluster manager, or update the tags assigned to the cluster manager. Properties and tag updates can be done independently.
commands.syntax:
az networkcloud clustermanager update [--cluster-manager-name]
                                      [--ids]
                                      [--mi-system-assigned {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                      [--mi-user-assigned]
                                      [--resource-group]
                                      [--subscription]
                                      [--tags]
examples: az networkcloud clustermanager update --name "clusterManagerName" --tags key1="myvalue1" key2="myvalue2" --resource-group "resourceGroupName"

commands.name: az networkcloud clustermanager wait
commands.summary: Place the CLI in a waiting state until a condition is met.
